file_content.text: You are alive, and our business is concluded.
Ah, I see your infection is progressing. Hold still, I will take samples for analysis.
While I transmit the data to Doctor Cel, there are some questions I should ask.
Do you have any of the following symptoms: dizziness, fever, shortness of breath or an inexhaustible hunger for sentient flesh?
Can you do anything about these cuts? I'm losing blood, here.
No, but I got clawed up.
I'm sorry, my core function is in analysis, not trauma care. Ah, here's Doctor Cel.
I could go for a nerf-burger. That doesn't count, right?
Now that you mention it....
I will note it on your chart. Ah, here's Doctor Cel.
None of your business.
I should warn you: Evasiveness and hostility are the first symptoms of the brain degeneration process. Ah, here's Doctor Cel.
Good news. Your antibody count is off the charts.
I'll start work on a vaccine immediately. You are remarkably brave. Our progress has just jumped forward by years.
While you recuperate, I'm going to transmit the usual secrecy agreements. Just use your thumbprint to sign on the sensor.
What do you mean "usual" secrecy agreements?
Since when do we do this?
Why?
This is standard procedure when the Republic develops biotech with significant earnings potential.
I'm not signing anything until I know what it is.
I don't think so. Slow down.
Oh, no, no. This is perfectly normal.
We develop the vaccine for Republic soldiers first, and when it's proven, sell it to colonists. Until then, it's under wraps.
We don't want the Exchange or the Sith funding some horrible operation with an underground version.
Lives will be lost while this profit is being made.
The vaccine should go to all.
Tell me something I don't know. Every week we hear another rakghoul horror story.
But every colonist on the planet is going to want this vaccine.
How do I tell my superiors we gave up that kind of money?
If you get a sample to the Jedi, I bet they'd find someone to make it fast.
Go around them.
I'll keep that in mind. We'll get this cure out one way or another.
An entire planet succumbed to this plague. Are you a doctor or a patent office?
Grow a spine!
I'm a doctor.
And this cure will get made, even if I have to build the manufacturing plant or hand-synthesize every macrophage....
Well, I think she's angry. But from past experience, may I say that usually motivates her.
If it means anything coming from a droid, sir, congratulations on your research and also, your remarkable survival.
Tell them I'm already selling my blood elsewhere to start up a competing cure.
So lie a little.
You know... that's not bad. It ought to light a fire under them.
Thanks for putting yourself on the line for this. It would have taken years to do it the safe way.
I don't know if Taris will ever be what it was, but now, at least, there's hope.
I guess that makes sense.
Sure, important people first.
Thanks for soldiering up. I'll see you get a donor fee, but I can't promise a cut of the profits.
The amount of money we're talking about is staggering. I could make a career out of a vaccine like this.
And you put yourself on the line to make it happen. I won't forget.
Doctor Cel has informed me of your experiment. Be certain to seek treatment here before any loss of consciousness.
Our team is observing rakghoul populations. Be advised it is not safe here.
